Junior High School.text: Which of these activities do you enjoy the most?
Junior High School.name: preferred-activity
options: Solving math problems and analyzing data
Writing essays, stories, or public speaking
Managing money, business plans, and entrepreneurship
Working with technology, coding, or hands-on projects
Playing sports and engaging in physical activities
Helping others, teaching, or discussing social issues

Junior High School.text: Which school subject do you perform best in?
Junior High School.name: best-subject

Junior High School.text: What type of career do you see yourself in the future?
Junior High School.name: career-goal

Junior High School.text: If given a project, what role do you usually take?
Junior High School.name: project-role
options: Leader or strategist who organizes and makes decisions
Researcher who gathers and analyzes data
Creative designer who makes visuals, videos, or presentations
Speaker or presenter who explains and engages with an audience
Hands-on worker who builds or fixes things
Problem solver who finds logical solutions
Team player who supports and motivates others

Junior High School.text: How do you prefer to solve problems?
Junior High School.name: problem-solving
options: Thinking creatively and coming up with unique ideas
Using hands-on skills and practical knowledge
Seeking advice from mentors, books, or online sources

Junior High School.text: If you had to choose a project, which would you enjoy the most?
Junior High School.name: preferred-project
options: Building a robot or developing an app
Writing and directing a play or film
Starting a small business or planning a financial strategy
Researching social issues and writing an analysis
Creating an artwork, music piece, or digital design
Training and preparing for a sports competition
Working on mechanical, electrical, or technical repairs

Junior High School.text: Which of these skills do you think is your strongest?
Junior High School.name: strongest-skill

Junior High School.text: Which of these school activities do you enjoy the most?
Junior High School.name: school-activity

Junior High School.text: What motivates you the most when choosing a career?
Junior High School.name: career-motivation
options: Doing something I love and enjoy
Helping others and making an impact
Being my own boss and having independence
Working on creative and innovative projects
Being recognized for my talents and achievements

Junior High School.text: How confident are you in your career choice?
Junior High School.name: career-confidence
options: Very confident – I already know my path
Somewhat confident – I have an idea but need more information
Unsure – I am still exploring my options
Not confident – I have no idea what I want to do yet

Senior High School.text: What is your dream college course choice?
Senior High School.name: college-course-choice

Senior High School.text: Do you want to take a college course related to your SHS strand?
Senior High School.name: shs-course-relation
options: Yes, I want to continue in the same field.
No, I want to shift to a different field.

Senior High School.text: Why did you decide to continue or shift from your SHS strand?
Senior High School.name: shs-course-decision
options: I enjoy my SHS strand and want to pursue it further.
I discovered new interests outside my strand.
My SHS strand does not match my career goals.
Job demand and salary influenced my choice.

Senior High School.text: How will you decide on your college course?
Senior High School.name: college-course-decision
options: Based on my personal interests and passion
High demand in the job market

Senior High School.text: Do you feel pressured to take a specific course?
Senior High School.name: college-course-pressure
options: Yes, by society or job demand.

Senior High School.text: How important is job availability in your decision?
Senior High School.name: job-availability-importance

Senior High School.text: What is your biggest concern in choosing a course?
Senior High School.name: college-course-concern

Senior High School.text: Have you considered taking a gap year?
Senior High School.name: gap-year-consideration
options: Yes, to explore options or work first.
No, I want to proceed immediately.

Senior High School.text: How confident are you in your chosen course?
Senior High School.name: college-confidence-level

Senior High School.text: What support would help you decide better?
Senior High School.name: college-decision-support
options: More exposure to professionals in the field

College.text: What career path are you currently considering?
College.name: career-path

College.text: How closely is your chosen career related to your college degree?
College.name: career-degree-relation

College.text: What is the biggest factor influencing your career choice?
College.name: career-choice-factor

College.text: Would you consider shifting to a different field?
College.name: career-shift
options: No, I want to stick to my field.
Maybe, if I develop new interests.

College.text: How confident are you in securing a job in your field?
College.name: job-confidence-level

College.text: Are you willing to take further training or certifications?
College.name: further-training
options: Maybe, if required for a job.

College.text: What is your biggest fear about working?
College.name: work-fear

College.text: Would you prefer to work in the Philippines or abroad?
College.name: work-location-preference

College.text: How important is work-life balance in choosing your career?
College.name: work-life-balance-importance

College.text: What kind of support would help you feel more prepared for your career?
College.name: career-preparation-support
